page.title: 15POWER SUPPLY
page.content: THE POWER FOR PEOPLES HOUSES IS MAINLY DONE BY ELECTRICITY. OIL STOVES AND OIL USED TO POWER THE HOUSES IN THE OLDEN DAYS. AT PATTERDALE HALL IT IS POWERED BY A LITTLE WATER MILL UNDER GROUND. POWER FOR THE MINES WAS WATER FROM RED TARN AND KEPPEL COVE. BUT THE DAM AT KEPPEL COVE BURST SO ALL THE WATER HAD TO COME FROM RED TARN TO POWER THE MINE. POWER FOR THE LAKE STEAMERS IS DONE BY DIESEL,BUT IT USED TO BE BY COAL. JET ENGINES POWER THE AIRCRAFTS THAT FLY LOW OVER HERE. ENGINES AND PETROL ARE USED TO MAKE CARS GO. AS THIS IS AN INTERESTING AREA FOR HOLIDAYMAKERS IT IS IMPORTANT TO MENTION THAT AN EVER-INCREASING WAY OF GETTING AROUND THE LAKE DISTRICT IS TO SIMPLY WALK. THIS IS THE BEST WAY TO SEE AND ENJOY THE COUNTRYSIDE.
